Security Best Practices

  • Access controls
  • PKI directory - make sure this is secure - group ownership and permissions so unauthorized people can't get these
  • Secure targeting (targeting via grains is not as secure - grains can be set by anyone - these can be faked)
  • Publish runner - you can grant too much access here
  • Reactors can potentially introduce security issues - after a minion submits an event, you should check who submitted this. Have any minion trigger the event. Case by case, use JINJA to double-check the ID of the minion.
  • Hashtypes for the fileserver - MD5 is not allowed under some standards, this can be changed.
  • Remove execution modules that you don't want to be used

Scalability/Efficiency

  • Config setting that prevents salt from searching for SLS files if it finds a directory without SLS files. - (good setting for lots of files)
  • Over 1000 minions turn on connection cache - master settings
  • Worker threads - more minions, more threads. (improves 0MQ performance, lets you handle more). CPU isn't spiking but things are slowing down, try this. Master side returners.
  • Job cache - keep to a reasonable size - this can slow things down. Keep jobs setting on the master - consider external job store
  • Upgrade. The latest release usually has many performance improvements.
